When I was Matron of MH acute wards I used to hold a monthly “Carers support group” in the evening, during visiting hours, with a lovely colleague from @TogetherMW It was really appreciated & well attended as it was arranged around carers’ preference

RT @DrGilluley: Spending morning with senior leaders @NHS_ELFT thinking about how we move forward with people participation and public invo…

@DrGilluley @NHS_ELFT @DrAmarShah @baggybinny 5/5 With ur current system, it seems the options are:
~we have to take days off school/work to be involved (attending a monthly meeting = 12 days leave)
~ur engagement is mostly with people who don’t work/attend school
Or, maybe we generate a range of other options together?

@DrGilluley @NHS_ELFT @DrAmarShah @baggybinny 3/5 Getting back to work is a key indicator of #recovery
The #CAMHS team echoed this, saying they have 2take days off school for treatment, which is necessary But now they’re engaged with the Trust they’re asked 2take days off school 2attend engagement meetings &staff interviews
@GlennMMitchell Thanks @GlennMMitchell 💐 it was great to meet you and other people I feel I already know, through Twitter. Congratulations on such a such an engaging & successful event #ELFTAMM

The 1st class service I received from @NHS_ELFT had such a positive impact on my #mentalhealth recovery & wellbeing

Sometimes I get a twinge of emotion when I talk publicly about my experience of receiving outstanding care when I felt so vulnerable, helpless & lost The consistently compassionate care I received throughout my inpatient stay and also from the @HackneyCRT was amazing.
